meanings.definition: To fill or crowd with people or things.
meanings.sent1: The stadium will be becrowded with fans for the big game.
meanings.sent2: The market square was becrowded with vendors selling their goods.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was becrowded with students eagerly waiting for the teacher to arrive.
meanings.sent4: The city streets becrowded with cars during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The concert hall was becrowded with music lovers enjoying the performance.

meanings.definition: To gather or assemble in a large group.
meanings.sent1: The protesters will be becrowding outside the government building.
meanings.sent2: The community center was becrowded with people attending the event.
meanings.sent3: The park was becrowded with families enjoying a picnic on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The airport terminal becrowded with travelers rushing to catch their flights.
meanings.sent5: The beach was becrowded with sunbathers soaking up the summer sun.
